task_definition_list.name: 56d10bfb_dag

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

inconf="@@{Apache1.ha_conf}@@,@@{Apache2.ha_conf}@@,@@{Apache3.ha_conf}@@"

inconf=${inconf//,/'\n'}

#take into account deleted conf (backend sacalein scenarios)
inconf=$(echo -e "$inconf" | grep -vi 'none')
echo -e "$inconf"

#initialize haproxycfg
#todo: read from calm
haproxycfg=\
"global\n"\
"   log /dev/log local0\n"\
"   log /dev/log local1 notice\n"\
"   chroot /var/lib/haproxy\n"\
"   stats timeout 30s\n"\
"   user haproxy\n"\
"   group haproxy\n"\
"   daemon\n"\
"\n"\
"defaults\n"\
"   log global\n"\
"   mode http\n"\
"   option httplog\n"\
"   option dontlognull\n"\
"   timeout connect 5000\n"\
"   timeout client 50000\n"\
"   timeout server 50000\n"

confFile='/tmp/test'
echo -e "$haproxycfg" > $confFile

#calc list of unique frontend names
frontends=$(echo -e "$inconf" | awk -F "|" '{print $1}' | sort | uniq)
#calc list of unique (frontend name, port) couples
frontends_ports=$(echo -e "$inconf" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{ print $1,$2 }' | sort | uniq)
#todo:raise error if frontends and frontends_ports lengths are different ==> port must be unique for one given frontend


#loop on discovered frontends
echo -e "$frontends" | while read frontend ; do
   #extract port for current frontend
   port=$(echo -e "$frontends_ports" | grep '^'$frontend'|.*' | awk -F '|' '{print $2}')

   #write frontend header to conf
   echo -e "\n\n\n"\
   "frontend $frontend\n"\
   "  bind *:$port\n"\
   "  stats uri /haproxy?stats\n"\
    >> $confFile

   #extract backends list (backend|contextRoot|serverAddress|serverPort) for current frontend
   backends_list=$(echo -e "$inconf" | grep '^'$frontend'|.*' | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $3,$4,$5,$6}')
   #calc list of unique backend names for current frontend
   backends=$(echo -e "$backends_list" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $1}' | sort | uniq)
   #calc list of unique (backend name, context root) couples
   backends_contexts=$(echo -e "$backends_list" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $1,$2}' | sort | uniq)
   #todo:raise error if backends and backends_contexts lengths are different ==> context root must be unique for one given backend

   #loop to write ACL rules for current frontend
   echo -e "$backends_contexts" | while read backend_context ; do
      backend=$(echo "$backend_context" | awk -F '|' '{print $1}')
      contextRoot=$(echo "$backend_context" | awk -F '|' '{print $2}')
      #write ACL rule to conf
         echo -e "\n"\
         "  acl $backend""_acl path_beg $contextRoot\n"\
         "  use_backend $backend if $backend""_acl\n"\
          >> $confFile
   done

   #loop to write backends to conf
   echo -e "$backends" | while read backend ; do
      #write backend header to conf
         echo -e "\n"\
         "backend $backend\n"\
         "  balance roundrobin"\
          >> $confFile
      #loop to write current backend servers
      echo -e "$backends_list" | grep '^'$backend'|.*'  | while read backend_line ; do
        serverAddress=$(echo "$backend_line" | awk -F '|' '{print $3}')
        serverPort=$(echo "$backend_line" | awk -F '|' '{print $4}')
        #write server to conf
        echo -e "   server server_$serverAddress $serverAddress:$serverPort check"\
         >> $confFile
      done
   done

done


echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'

cat $confFile > /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'
cat /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'
sudo service haproxy restart

task_definition_list.name: recreate haproxy cfg file and reload

attrs.script:
sudo yum install gcc pcre-devel tar make -y
sudo yum install wget -y
wget http://www.haproxy.org/download/2.0/src/haproxy-2.0.7.tar.gz -O ~/haproxy.tar.gz
tar xzvf ~/haproxy.tar.gz -C ~/
cd ~/haproxy-2.0.7
make TARGET=linux-glibc
sudo make install
sudo mkdir -p /etc/haproxy
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/haproxy 
sudo touch /var/lib/haproxy/stats
sudo ln -s /usr/local/sbin/haproxy /usr/sbin/haproxy
sudo cp ~/haproxy-2.0.7/examples/haproxy.init /etc/init.d/haproxy
sudo chmod 755 /etc/init.d/haproxy
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo chkconfig haproxy on
sudo useradd -r haproxy

child_tasks_local_reference_list: @{kind=app_task; name=recreate haproxy cfg file and reload}
task_definition_list.name: 56d10bfb_dag
recreate haproxy cfg file and reload

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

inconf="@@{Apache1.ha_conf}@@,@@{Apache2.ha_conf}@@,@@{Apache3.ha_conf}@@"

inconf=${inconf//,/'\n'}

#take into account deleted conf (backend sacalein scenarios)
inconf=$(echo -e "$inconf" | grep -vi 'none')
echo -e "$inconf"

#initialize haproxycfg
#todo: read from calm
haproxycfg=\
"global\n"\
"   log /dev/log local0\n"\
"   log /dev/log local1 notice\n"\
"   chroot /var/lib/haproxy\n"\
"   stats timeout 30s\n"\
"   user haproxy\n"\
"   group haproxy\n"\
"   daemon\n"\
"\n"\
"defaults\n"\
"   log global\n"\
"   mode http\n"\
"   option httplog\n"\
"   option dontlognull\n"\
"   timeout connect 5000\n"\
"   timeout client 50000\n"\
"   timeout server 50000\n"

confFile='/tmp/test'
echo -e "$haproxycfg" > $confFile

#calc list of unique frontend names
frontends=$(echo -e "$inconf" | awk -F "|" '{print $1}' | sort | uniq)
#calc list of unique (frontend name, port) couples
frontends_ports=$(echo -e "$inconf" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{ print $1,$2 }' | sort | uniq)
#todo:raise error if frontends and frontends_ports lengths are different ==> port must be unique for one given frontend


#loop on discovered frontends
echo -e "$frontends" | while read frontend ; do
   #extract port for current frontend
   port=$(echo -e "$frontends_ports" | grep '^'$frontend'|.*' | awk -F '|' '{print $2}')

   #write frontend header to conf
   echo -e "\n\n\n"\
   "frontend $frontend\n"\
   "  bind *:$port\n"\
   "  stats uri /haproxy?stats\n"\
    >> $confFile

   #extract backends list (backend|contextRoot|serverAddress|serverPort) for current frontend
   backends_list=$(echo -e "$inconf" | grep '^'$frontend'|.*' | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $3,$4,$5,$6}')
   #calc list of unique backend names for current frontend
   backends=$(echo -e "$backends_list" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $1}' | sort | uniq)
   #calc list of unique (backend name, context root) couples
   backends_contexts=$(echo -e "$backends_list" | awk -F '|' -v OFS='|' '{print $1,$2}' | sort | uniq)
   #todo:raise error if backends and backends_contexts lengths are different ==> context root must be unique for one given backend

   #loop to write ACL rules for current frontend
   echo -e "$backends_contexts" | while read backend_context ; do
      backend=$(echo "$backend_context" | awk -F '|' '{print $1}')
      contextRoot=$(echo "$backend_context" | awk -F '|' '{print $2}')
      #write ACL rule to conf
         echo -e "\n"\
         "  acl $backend""_acl path_beg $contextRoot\n"\
         "  use_backend $backend if $backend""_acl\n"\
          >> $confFile
   done

   #loop to write backends to conf
   echo -e "$backends" | while read backend ; do
      #write backend header to conf
         echo -e "\n"\
         "backend $backend\n"\
         "  balance roundrobin"\
          >> $confFile
      #loop to write current backend servers
      echo -e "$backends_list" | grep '^'$backend'|.*'  | while read backend_line ; do
        serverAddress=$(echo "$backend_line" | awk -F '|' '{print $3}')
        serverPort=$(echo "$backend_line" | awk -F '|' '{print $4}')
        #write server to conf
        echo -e "   server server_$serverAddress $serverAddress:$serverPort check"\
         >> $confFile
      done
   done

done


echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'

cat $confFile > /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'
cat /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo '**#####*****###########****#######***\n\n'
sudo service haproxy restart
